title.native: ゾン100～ゾンビになるまでにしたい100のこと～
title.romaji: Zom 100: Zombie ni Naru Made ni Shitai 100 no Koto
title.english: Zom 100: Bucket List of the Dead

description:
Surviving a zombie apocalypse beats being a wage slave any day! After spending years slaving away for a soul-crushing company, Akira's life has lost its luster. He lives in a trash-filled apartment, his pay is abysmal, and he can't even muster up the nerve to confess his love to his beautiful co-worker. But when a zombie apocalypse ravages his town, it gives him the push he needs to live for himself. Now Akira's on a mission to complete all 100 items on his bucket list before he...well, kicks the bucket.

(Source: Viz Media)
synonyms: Zombie 100 ~100 Things I Want to do Before I Become a Zombie~
Zombie 100 ~Zombie ni Naru Made ni Shitai 100 no Koto~
100 สิ่งที่อยากทำก่อนจะกลายเป็นซอมบี้
100 Coisas para Fazer Antes de Virar Zumbi

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Motorcycles
tags.description: Prominently features the use of motorcycles.

tags.name: Rugby
tags.description: Centers around the sport of rugby.

tags.name: Achromatic
tags.description: Contains animation that is primarily done in black and white.

tags.name: Cultivation
tags.description: Features characters using training, often martial arts-related, and other special methods to cultivate qi (a component of traditional Chinese philosophy, described as "life force") and gain strength or immortality.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Office
tags.description: Features people who work in a business office.

title.native: ゾン100 ～ゾンビになるまでにしたい100のこと～

name.native: ベアトリクス・アメルハウザー

node.description:
[Official Website](https://ameblo.jp/asoharo/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/asoharoo)

In 2004 Haro Aso was selected to receive Shonen Sunday's Manga College Award for "YUNGE!" In 2007, after the success of his short story, Onigami Amon, Aso got the chance to start a series of his own. In 2008 his series Hyde & Closer was published in Weekly Shonen Sunday.

Once the assistant of [Raiku Makoto](https://anilist.co/staff/97657/MakotoRaiku).

[Sugawara Kenji](https://anilist.co/staff/112031/KenjiSugawara) was his assistant.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kazuki_kawagoe)

Affiliated with [BUG FILMS](https://anilist.co/studio/7348/). Formerly affiliated with [OLM](https://anilist.co/studio/28/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/makoto_myzk) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/宮崎誠)

A music creator for the creative music unit [(K)NoW_NAME](https://anilist.co/staff/126602/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/797827498302001152)

Freelance animator. 

Formerly affiliated with [OLM](https://anilist.co/studio/28/OLM) between April 2016 to December 2021, and with [BUG FILMS](https://anilist.co/studio/7348/BUG-FILMS) until December 2023.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kojima2019)

Animation Producer. Previously leader of [OLM](https://anilist.co/studio/28/OLM) Team Kojima, currently CEO of [BUG FILMS](https://anilist.co/studio/7348/BUG-FILMS).

__Members:__
- Maguro Taniguchi (lead vocals, rhythm guitar) - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanaboonmaguro) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/taniguchi_maguro)
- Hayato Koga (lead guitar, backing vocals) - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanaboontuna) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kanaboontuna)
- Takahiro Koizumi (drums) - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanaboonkoicha)

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kanaboon_official_insta) |  [Twitter](https://twitter.com/_kanaboon) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/KANABOONVEVO/) | [Official Website](https://sp.kanaboon.jp/) 

A Japanese rock band formed in 2008, currently associated with Ki/oon Music. They've had four albums reach the top ten on the weekly Oricon Albums Chart. They have also had five singles reach the top ten on the weekly Oricon Singles Chart.

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Label:__ Sony Music Japan (Since 2022)

__[Website](https://shiyui.jp) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Shiyui_0111) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/72320879) |[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCXgMg81GVAzdFWQNJFKiJgQ) | [NicoNico](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/117211278) | [Spotify (Shiyui)](https://open.spotify.com/artist/16ROxNSgWNSQIuIO8gNQyz) | [Spotify (シユイ)](https://open.spotify.com/artist/3EKiz61ZCQs4LK3O96mt5O)__

__Shiyui__ is a Japanese singer and Illustrator.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1949484145)

Affiliated with [BUG FILMS](https://anilist.co/studio/7348). He was previously affiliated with [OLM](https://anilist.co/studio/28/OLM).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/williamleeanim)

An American-Japanese animator living in Tokyo. Affiliated with [BUG FILMS](https://anilist.co/studio/7348).
